meanings.definition: To blow up, shatter, or destroy with dynamite.
meanings.sent1: The old building was dynamited to make space for a new one.
meanings.sent2: The miners dynamited the rocks to extract valuable minerals.
meanings.sent3: The prankster dynamited a cake for a surprise explosion at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her powerful speech dynamited the arguments of her opponents.
meanings.sent5: The action movie scene was dynamited to create a thrilling explosion.

meanings.sent1: The construction crew dynamited the area yesterday.
meanings.sent2: They dynamited the dam last week to prevent flooding.
meanings.sent3: The kids dynamited their sandcastle before leaving the beach.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins were dynamited centuries ago by invaders.
meanings.sent5: The mountain was dynamited years ago to build the highway through it.
